channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report E-2023100463
item.description:
Report E-2023100463

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-16T18:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: MEAD
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDEX FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Associate did not block and/or brace freight properly for transport. Freight was crushed causing release of product.

item.title: Report X-2023090991
item.description:
Report X-2023090991

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-20T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package had a strong smell and was brought to QA. Upon inspection 1 of the 3 glass bottles was broken and contents had leaked out. DescribePack: Packaging was not packed correctly. The bottles were small and the box was big causing the bottles to shake around the box easily. They clanked against each other causing one of them to break. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed in a bag and red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023090936
item.description:
Report X-2023090936

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-19T15:12:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-18
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found soiled and stained. Brought to damages for inspection. DescribePack: Found inner bag to be stained near lid with cap loose allowing about 1oz of liquid to spill out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Lid sealed and contents contained.

item.title: Report X-2023090932
item.description:
Report X-2023090932

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-19T15:12:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-18
  • City: JOHNSTOWN
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package placed alone at the end of the hold trailer on Saturday 09/16. Package discovered Mon having leaked. DescribePack: Package suffered from thermal expansion and loose caps causing an internal leakage of contents. Package has no loose cap protection and to heavy for seal on bottom of package. DurationRel: 48 and MitigateEffect: package immediatly moved to red tote and stored safely away

Report X-2023090904

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: received pkg wet off of truck immediately contained package and started HESS process DescribePack: seal on cap leaked DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: put it in hazmat tote

item.title: Report X-2023090889
item.description:
Report X-2023090889

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-18T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment was discovered in the unload after opening the trailer. It was damaged before anyone in Aurora laid a hand on the box. Swift action taken by an Admin mitigated the effects of the released contents. DescribePack: One of the four bottles has a small millimeter sized hole near the top of the bottle, just below the closure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Like I said before, swift action by an Admin mitigated the released contents. Absorbent pads and latex gloves were used to secure the shipment and the surrounding areas.

item.title: Report X-2023090887
item.description:
Report X-2023090887

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-18T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: BROOMFIELD
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This damaged hazmat was discovered by a trainer that was splitting for vanline 3. The trainer called me over to p/u this hazmat and two other hazmats from the same shipper that leaked. I placed hazmats in red totes/plastic bags and stored them in QA1. DescribePack: The air relief cap was loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed in a red tote and plastic bag.

item.title: Report X-2023090871
item.description:
Report X-2023090871

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-18T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A fully regulated package came to QA wet and soiled after inspection loose caps on a drum caused the spill soiling other content. DescribePack: punctured and loose caps on a drum caused the spill. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was brought to QA in a lined tote for inspection.
